title: Present Continuous
description: The present continuous is used to talk about actions happening now or around now. It is also used for future plans.

subtopics.title: Affirmative Sentences
subtopics.description: Use 'am/is/are' + verb-ing to say what is happening now.

subtopics.title: Negative Sentences
subtopics.description: Use 'am/is/are not' + verb-ing to say something is not happening.

subtopics.title: Questions
subtopics.description: Put 'am/is/are' before the subject to ask about actions happening now.

examples.sample: Is she coming to the party?

subtopics.title: Future Arrangements
subtopics.description: Use the present continuous to talk about future plans.

examples.sample: I am meeting my friend tomorrow.
She is flying to Paris next week.
We are having a party on Friday.

exercises.question: How do you ask about an action now?

exercises.instruction: Rewrite as a question: 'He is playing football.'
